intro: Thesium semotum, commonly known as the mountain thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in high-altitude regions, particularly in the Andes and other mountainous areas of South America. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color, and it has a compact, mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are leathery and evergreen, adapted to the cold and dry conditions of its native habitat. Thesium semotum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
